artists.name: Reid Miles
artists.style: Bold typography, minimalist layouts, stylish black-and-white photography.
artists.quotes: "It’s all about rhythm — not just in music, but in design."

artists.name: Storm Thorgerson (Hipgnosis)
artists.famous_for: Pink Floyd (Dark Side of the Moon, Wish You Were Here), Led Zeppelin (Houses of the Holy)
artists.style: Surreal, dreamlike, and thought-provoking photo-based designs. Helped redefine what an album cover could be — almost like album covers as fine art.
artists.quotes: "You don’t just design a cover; you create an atmosphere, a mystery."

artists.name: Pete Saville
artists.style: Minimalist, experimental, used scientific and abstract imagery with cool muted palettes.
artists.quotes: "Design should be open to interpretation — like the music itself."

artists.name: Barney Bubbles
artists.style: Playful, rebellious, mixed retro graphics with punk attitude — sometimes coded his work with hidden messages.
artists.quotes: "If you can read it easily, you’re doing it wrong."

artists.name: Jean-Paul Goude
artists.famous_for: Grace Jones album covers like Island Life
artists.style: Visually stunning photography combined with surreal graphic manipulation. Totally sculpted Grace Jones' visual persona.
artists.quotes: "Photography isn’t just capturing reality — it’s inventing a new one."

artists.name: Art Kane
artists.famous_for: Music photography for The Who, Cream, Bob Dylan, Frank Zappa
artists.style: Bold color usage, narrative-driven photography that often felt cinematic and larger-than-life.
artists.quotes: "A great photograph is a performance frozen in time."
